intro: Chamaemelum macrophyllum, commonly known as sweet everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has aromatic leaves and stems, which contain essential oils responsible for its pleasant scent. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its hardiness and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
